emails.subject: URGENT Notification: Temperature Excursion for DNL593/Placebo - Site 101
emails.body:
Dear Alex,

This is an urgent notification regarding a temperature excursion for the Investigational Product refrigerator at Site 101, Maplewood Clinical Research Center.

The excursion was noted this morning at 8:00 AM EST. The refrigerator stores all kits for the DNL593 study, including active drug and placebo.

Details:
- Duration of excursion: Approximately 6 hours (from 1:45 AM to 7:45 AM EST).
- Minimum Temperature Recorded: 1.2°C
- Maximum Temperature Recorded: 9.5°C (briefly)
- Standard Range: 2°C to 8°C

I have attached the continuous temperature monitoring log for your review. All affected DNL593 and placebo kits have been identified and remain in the refrigerator, but are not being dispensed.

Please provide immediate guidance on the viability of the affected product and instructions on next steps.

Best regards,

Dr. Sarah Chen
Investigational Drug Pharmacist
Maplewood Clinical Research Center
(555) 123-4567

emails.subject: Re: URGENT Notification: Temperature Excursion for DNL593/Placebo - Site 101
emails.body:
Hi Sarah,

Thank you for the prompt and detailed notification. I have received the temperature log.

Please immediately quarantine all affected DNL593 and placebo kits. Label the stock clearly with "QUARANTINED - DO NOT USE PENDING SPONSOR ASSESSMENT."

I am looping in David Lee, our Clinical Supply Manager at Denali, to conduct a formal stability assessment based on the data you provided.

David, can you please review the attached log from the previous email and advise on the viability of the product? Please let us know if you require any further information from the site.

Sarah, we will provide further instructions as soon as the assessment is complete. Please confirm once the product has been quarantined.

Best regards,

Alex Johnson
Clinical Research Associate
Denali Therapeutics

role_descriptions: alex.johnson@denalitx.com: Denali Therapeutics (Sponsor), Clinical Research Associate
david.lee@denalitx.com: Denali Therapeutics (Sponsor), Clinical Supply Manager

description: An urgent notification from a site pharmacist regarding a temperature excursion in the refrigerator storing the DNL593 and placebo. The thread shows Alex Johnson coordinating with Denali's clinical supply manager to determine if the product is still viable and providing instructions to the site to quarantine the affected stock.
